Mobiles.LongDescription: `bAuvyron, the heretic mage lurks here, preparing to escape his prison.``
Mobiles.Description: `aThe Heretic Mage.  The Evil One.  Destroyer of Faiths.  All theseepithets and more too gruesome to tell have been said of this man over thecenturies he has plagued these realms.  Of a medium build, and taller thanmost, `bAuvyron `afloats a foot or so off the polished floor.  Dressed in a`ibloodred `arobe inlaid with sparkling yellow `krunes`a around the hood, heglows with an otherworldly light.  Of course, you didn't need to know thatthis was evil incarnate.  Perhaps the incense that wafts a smell of old,dried blood across the stifling hot air precludes any thought of redeemingthis man, or reimprisoning him.  Perhaps it is the sight of his `msoul`achained to the lone supporting pillar.  Perhaps it is this man's eyes,which are mere pits into a `ksulfurous `ihell`a.

Mobiles.LongDescription: A deranged brother shuffles around the maze here.``
Mobiles.Description: `oThis Brother of Erion was one of the earlier visitors to the `bHell ofAuvyron`o.  As the maze became warped to the evil of Auvyron's soul, somemembers of the Abbey entered the maze to try and correct the growing chaos.This wretched soul is one example of what happens to those of weak faiththat enter this place.  It is obvious that this monk's  mind has been eatenaway, and his body has been changed to suit Auvyron's purposes.  A`m`jsnake`o `otongue darts out over drooling lips, and small, dirty brownscales cover his body.  A feral light enters this abandoned soul's eyes asyou notice him, and he springs at you, trying in vain to exorcise his owndemons.

Mobiles.LongDescription: A deranged brother shuffles around the maze here.``
Mobiles.Description: `oThis Brother of Erion was one of the earlier visitors to the `bHell ofAuvyron`o.  As the maze became warped to the evil of Auvyron's soul, somemembers of the Abbey entered the maze to try and correct the growing chaos.This wretched soul is one example of what happens to those of weak faiththat enter this place.  It is obvious that this monk's mind has been eatenaway, and his body has been changed to suit Auvyron's purposes.  A`m`jsnake`o `otongue darts out over drooling lips, and small, dirty brownscales cover his body.  A feral light enters this abandoned soul's eyes asyou notice him, and he springs at you, trying in vain to exorcise his owndemons.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `dAn amazed Minotaur is here, seeking the lair of `bAuvyron`d.``
Mobiles.Description: `dThis hulking beast stands before you, looking as if carved out of thebole of some gnarled, mountainside tree that was struck by a bolt of`klightning`d.  He is dressed all in boiled leather, with straps holdingsome implements of navigating this maze.  From the pointy horns atop hisflea-bitten head to his slightly cloven hooves, he stands about ten feettall.  Some legends would have it that this beast is little more than abrute, killing machine, but there seems to be a glint of cunning and purposein his yellowed eyes.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `mThe Soul of Auvyron `astalks you, as inevitable as the grave.``
Mobiles.Description: `aAs more and more of the lifeforce of Auvyron was expended in thecorrputing of his prison, he finally broke down and set his soul itself towander the maze alone, searching for those who would thwart its master'splans.  On this plane, it does not even exist, but instead, `lpervades`athis place.  It shows itself in the slight deadening of drips of water, inthe cruel lifelesness of the air, and mirrored in the deeps of the mad, madsky.

Mobiles.LongDescription: A transformed novice is here, a sorry amalgam of chaotic parts.
Mobiles.Description: `lPeople who fail to complete the `bHell of Auvyron `ltend to end uplooking like this.  After wandering the maze for uncounted time, the chaostook its effect on this once humble novice, transforming him into themonstrosity you see before you.  `jLime green `lfins sprout from his back,and flaming, `iruby red `leyes jut from this piteous soul's elongated face.Dressed in a dark, `asoot-colored `lcloak and hood, he avoids joining withhis former brethren in singing their praises to their new master,`bAuvyron`l.  ``

Mobiles.LongDescription: `cA mass of teeth, spines, and thorns, a demon from the `ifiery`c plane of `bNalax`c hovers above.``
Mobiles.Description: `lOne of the first extraplanar excursions `bAuvyron `ltook after escapingfrom the forces of the `kArgent Lance `lwas to the fiery plane of`iNalaxos`l.  The inhabitants of that place are demons, and the very fewtales that have come out of that place, usually shared by retired mages inthe shadows and warmth of the mage guild, are that the denizens look like across between a jellyfish and a she-wolf.  In exchange for some of theirpeople's aid in conquering his prison, `bAuvyron `lpromised them mortalhosts.  This demon floats through the air lazily, as if surveying prey,possibly you.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `oA corrupted `kPaladin `ostands here, willfully serving his new god, `bAuvyron`o.``
Mobiles.Description: `oThis forgotten soul was once a proud `kpaladin `oof the Argent LanceOrder before foolishly vowing at a feast to slay the heretic mage `bAuvyron`oin single combat.  Seemingly untouched physically by the terror of thisplace, nevertheless this paladin now worships `bAuvyron `oas his savior.  Hestands a little shy of six feet tall, and has sandy blonde hair, but theunhealthy greenish tint to his eyes betrays his presence as familiar to thisplace.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aAn acolyte of `bAuvyron `alies in wait here, draped in dark robes and the silent darkness.``
Mobiles.Description: `cThis lustful follower of `bAuvyron `c was rewarded with his rank upon`bAuvyron's`c corruption of his jail.  A young, frenetic man, he holds ashimmering, oaken cudgel in one hand, as he reaches for a `adull iron`cpoiniard tied loosely into his sash.  `cHis face is horribly scarred, withone vivid streak nearly bisecting his face from top to bottom, which givesthis acolyte a terribly evil sneer.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aAn acolyte of `bAuvyron `alies in wait here, draped in dark robes and the silent darkness.``
Mobiles.Description: `bThis lustful follower of `iAuvyron `bwas rewarded with her rank upon`iAuvyron's `bcorruption of his jail.  Dressed in sooty robes like all theother acolytes here, she seems unremarkable at first glance.  However,further inspection reveals the subtle scents of a mage, which some liken toa death from spicy rose petals.  She wears a webbed bandolier across herample chest, which bodes ill for those who challenge her might in thisplace.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aAn acolyte of `bAuvyron `alies in wait here, draped in dark robes and the silent darkness.``
Mobiles.Description: `fThis lustful follower of `bAuvyron `fwas rewarded with his rank for hisassistance in trapping `kMalrezni, beloved of the light`f.  Standing awarped five feet tall, this evil man would be much taller if not for thehunch in his back.  His dark robes are specially cut to fit his physique,and a palpable fear surrounds him.  `fHe clutches a `mglowing `famulet inone palsied hand, and prepares to smite you with the power of his twistedsoul.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aA hulking Vro'ath is here, engaged in a bizarre and deadly struggle.``
Mobiles.Description: `oThis creature was once a hideous `aVro'ath `owho came to pledge hisservices to the heretic mage, `bAuvyron`o.  True to his evil nature, thebeast was immediately chosen to receive a `iN`ca`il`ca`ix`ci`in`o spiritinto his body.  Unfortunately, `bAuvyron`o did not ponder the possibilitythat the melding of beast and demonic spirit would not take.  The sorryresult of this you see before you.  Standing around twelve feet tall, andcovered in a phosphorescent orange goo, it sprouts both limp tentacles fromits upper arms and a row of thorny spikes that jut from its spinal column.Alternately writhing on the floor in pain and striking itself with a baredfist, this is not a creature anyone in their right mind should approach.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `gA `jmad `gshrike is here, twisted and filled with hate by the power of `bAuvyron`g.``
Mobiles.Description: `gThis noble bird of prey once roamed the skies above `bAuvyron's`gprison.  Upon his escape, however, `bAuvyron `gmanaged to lure a smallfraction of the animal life placed into his prison into his laboratory, andsubsequently experimented on those unfortunate enough to survive.  Thismalign beast is one example.  It radiates the stench of evil, and its mostevident feature is a large third eye centered in its forehead.  It seems tobe wounded: twisted out of its natural cycle to become a fearsome reminderof the power of evil.  It flaps heavily toward you, tormented but deadly.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `cA young woman reclines in her hammock here, waiting for guests.``
Mobiles.Description: `dA young, almost innocent syvin stretches out lazily in a hammock strungbetween the two poles of her tent.  She wears a small, `cgreen`d dress thatseems to be made of feathers and leaves, that reflect all the colors ofnature.  She gazes outside her haven with a weary look in her eyes at allthe madness, as if to say 'Outside this place, I have so little power; buthere, I am freed of the fetters on my soul and have been appointed to dowhat I can'.  Her beautiful, `gc`nl`oo`gu`ld`oy `nb`ll`gu`ee`d eyes knowsuffering and patience, and she has dedicated her life to sharing the beautyof her soul with those graced enough to find her.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `jA huge, spongy, oozing beast is here, waiting for its master.``
Mobiles.Description: `jThis....  Thing seems to be a hulking pile of goo!  It has a stickysurface that has a faint glow to it, and has created a hardened place aroundits middle so that those denizens of Auvyron who must travel his jailquickly can ride on it.  It manages to move by extending part of itselfforward, and retracting itself behind, almost as if pouring itself out in asickening fashion.  It's smell reeks of rot, dirt, and some synthetic,unnatural odor.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `fA nightmare of horn and shell charges at you!``
Mobiles.Description: `fEven if you had time to get a good look at this beast before it wasupon you, it would be nearly impossible to describe.  It has a `kgolden`fcolor, but that may be the dust it raises to hide itself from view againstthe hard, baked earth.  Gleaming, purple-whorled shell protects this monsterfrom the attacks of all but the most seasoned warrior.  Virulent, `bred`feyes peer out at you from deep underneath this mass of armor, radiatingcunning.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `eGalnorin, a brother of Erion stands before you, shaking his head sadly.``
Mobiles.Description: `lOnce a fierce paladin in the service of the `kArgent Lance`l, Galnorinwas one of the few lucky ones who survived the `bAuvyron `lcampaign.  Thesights he witnessed during those heroic days, from `ifire `lflowing likewater to stalk and kill his troops to the End of things Holy, as the daemon`kZatel`l opened the Gate of Sorrow changed him forever.  He retired to thisplace and this duty: To ward the prison of `bAuvyron`l against those whowould open it as long as he lived.  He wears the `hwhite`l robes of theErion Order, and the `gazure`l cloak and `ablack steel`l gauntlets of apaladin.  He still carries his heft well, but his tonsure is rimed with a`osilver frost`l, showing his age.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `dA man stands here, willing to journey with you to face `bAuvyron`d.``
Mobiles.Description: `dThis young man stands about five and a half feet tall.  Born into alife of bowing and scraping to a new petty lordlet every week, he decided tochance descending into the bowels of the earth and offer his assistance tothose willing to face `bAuvyron`d.  His face is deeply tanned from his timeoutdoors, and even though the Brothers feed and clothe him better than heever could have on the surface, a certain roughness of voice and propensityto gather around the gaming tables in the festhall in back demonstrates thathe is of a lesser class than most.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `gA battle-hardened veteran of Galnorin's company stands ready.``
Mobiles.Description: `lThis gentleman stands just under six feet tall, and wears thebroad-bladed sword and`a black chain armor`l of the Knights of the `kArgentLance`l as if he's held them for years.  He is heavily muscled and in theprime of life but his face bears the psychic scars of witnessing events thatnormal men should not.  He shoulders his pack and prepares to descend deepinto the maze.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `kAn elderly Paladin of Erion waits patiently for the end.``
Mobiles.Description: `cSome wonder what drove this elegant, old man underground - and whathorrors he witnessed that urge him to stay here and offer his services asprotector and guide to those audacious enough to enter this place.  He wearsthe robes and cloak of a paladin easily, and his only weapon is his`dpenitent's staff`c that he clutches in one, trembling hand.  But to lookat his outward appearance and scoff would be foolhardy, for this man aloneamong his brethren had the strength of will and purity of mind to forceclosed the Gate of Sorrow.  ``

Mobiles.LongDescription: `kA luminous being stands here, chained to the pillar with fetters of `airon`k.``
Mobiles.Description: `kA demigod in her own right, Malrezni chose to give up some of herlife-force to aid in the permanence of `bAuvyron's`k prison.  As his hate isunbounded for those who would thwart his designs, `bAuvyron's`k first movewas to enchain this blissful spirit within the `apillar`k that untilrecently housed his `msoul`k.  Only the weakening of `bAuvyron's`k spiritallowed her to reach this plane, so what you can see is more dreamlike thannot.  She still has no form; just a presence: The majesty of a`gs`at`eo`gr`am`a-`ei`gn`af`el`ga`am`ee`ad`k ocean, the peace of an oldchurchyard, the love that the eternal `cForest`k feels for its Rangers.Malrezni encompasses those and more, and her light illumines the room andyour soul.  ``

Mobiles.LongDescription: A Brother of Erion wanders around, contemplating life... and death.
`dAnother denizen of `bThe Hell of Auvyron `dslumps toward you.``
Mobiles.Description: `dAnother one of `bAuvyron's`d creations shambles toward you.  It couldbe nearly anything.  It's really big, and seems to be made of mud that wasshaped with an eye towards unholiness.  To allow this construct to move, itsjoints have been animated with an evil `jgreen`d light.  Its approach makesthe ground shake as it shambles toward you.

Mobiles.LongDescription: A transformed novice is here, a sorry amalgam of chaotic parts.
Mobiles.Description: `lPeople who fail to complete the `bHell of Auvyron `ltend to end uplooking like this.  After wandering the maze for uncounted time, the chaostook its effect on this once humble novice, transforming him into themonstrosity you see before you.  `jLime green `lfins sprout from his back,and flaming, `iruby red `leyes jut from this piteous soul's elongated face.Dressed in a dark, `asoot-colored `lcloak and hood, he avoids joining withhis former brethren in singing their praises to their new master,`bAuvyron`l.  ``

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aA `ihellish`a construct of old, blasted death is here.``
Mobiles.Description: `aThis jumbled pile of bones makes a quiet clicking sound as itapproaches.  Created by the power of evil, it seems to have the snout andfangs of a wolf, the tail of some long-dead lizard, the legs of an elephant,and the torso of a human.  Sickly `mpurple`a light plays about its skeletaljoints, providing not only motive power, but freedom of movement to crushthe foes of `bAuvyron`a.  ``

Mobiles.LongDescription: `lA `kglowing`l orb floats here, displaying shimmering fractal patterns.
Mobiles.Description: One of the strangest sights in this unholy place, a smallish ball of someshiny metal floats just out of reach.  Imprinted all over its surface withtiny, glinting runes that ebb and flow in fractal patterns, mesmerizing eventhe most pensive person.  At first glance, these glowing spheres might betaken as lights, but the thought that goes into the creation of the patternswhorling on the surface of these things requires sentience.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `gA `jmad`g shrike is here, glaring at you cunningly.``
Mobiles.Description: `gThis noble bird of prey once roamed the skies above `bAuvyron's`gprison.  Upon his escape, however, `bAuvyron`g managed to lure a smallfraction of the animal life placed into his prison into his laboratory, andsubsequently experimented on those unfortunate enough to survive.  Thismalign beast is one example.  It radiates the stench of evil, and its mostevident feature is a large third eye centered in its forehead.  It seems tobe wounded: twisted out of its natural cycle to become a fearsome reminderof the power of evil.  It flaps heavily toward you, tormented but deadly.

Mobiles.LongDescription: Salnorin is here
`gA `jmad`g shrike is here, watching you silently.``

Upon his escape, however, `bAuvyron `gmanaged to lure a smallfraction of the animal life placed into his prison into his laboratory, andsubsequently experimented on those unfortunate enough to survive.  Thismalign beast is one example.  It radiates the stench of evil, and its mostevident feature is a large third eye centered in its forehead.  It seems tobe wounded: twisted out of its natural cycle to become a fearsome reminderof the power of evil.  It flap`ls`g heavily toward you, tormented but deadly.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `aA`i hellish`a construct seems to have a purpose in waiting for you here.
Mobiles.Description: `aThis jumbled pile of bones makes a quiet clicking sound as itapproaches.  Created by the power of evil, it seems to have the snout andfangs of a wolf, the tail of some long-dead l`li`azard, the legs of an elephant,and the torso of a human.  Sickly `mpurple`a light plays about its skeletaljoints, providing not only motive power, but freedom of movement to crushthe foes of `bAuvyron`a.  ``

Mobiles.LongDescription: This monstrous beast should not be able to speak, but does.
Mobiles.Description: `l`oPeople who fail to complete the `bHell of Auvyron`o `l`otend to end uplooking like this.  After wandering the maze for uncounted time, the chaostook its effect on this once humble novice, transforming him into themonstrosity you see before you.  `jLime `jgreen`o `l`ofins sprout from his back,and flaming, `iruby `ired`o `l`oeyes jut from this piteous soul's elongated face.`oDressed in a dark, `asoot-colored`o cloak and hood, he avoids joining withhis former brethren in singing their praises to their new master,`bAuvyron`o.   This one, however, has a bit of an amused e`lx`opressionon its mutilated face.  ``

Mobiles.LongDescription: `cA `kglowing`c orb floats here, displaying shimmering fractal `lp`catterns.``

Mobiles.Description: `jThis....  Thing seems to be a hulking pile of goo!  It has a stickysurface that has a faint glow to it, and has `lc`jreated a hardened place aroundits middle so that those denizens of Auvyron who must travel his jailquickly can ride on it.  It manages to move by extending part of itselfforward, and retracting itself behind, almost as if pouring itself out in asickening fashion.  It's smell reeks of rot, dirt, and some synthetic,unnatural odor.

Mobiles.LongDescription: `hA spirit emtombed in`a smoky`h glass floats about.``
Mobiles.Description: `hAt first, it seems like a huge, `lv`hulture-like thing.  As itapproaches, floating rather unsteadily on the heated air currents of thisdamned place, you can see the entrapped spirit within.  It may be best tokeep this thing at arm's reach, for the edges of its wings, and most of itsother surfaces seem razor sharp.

Mobiles.LongDescription: This monstrous beast should not be able to speak, but does.
Mobiles.Description: `l`oPeople who fail to complete the `bHell of Auvyron`o `l`otend to end uplooking like this.  After wandering the maze for uncounted time, the chaostook its effect on this once humble novice, transforming him into themonstrosity you see before you.  `jLime `jgreen`o `l`ofins sprout from his back,and flaming, `iruby `ired`o `l`oeyes jut from this piteous soul's elongated face.`oDressed in a dark, `asoot-colored`o cloak and hood, he avoids joining withhis former brethren in singing their praises to their new master,`bAuvyron`o.   This one, however, has a bit of an amused expression```oon its mutilated face.  ``

Rooms.RoomDescription: `aThick, gray stone walls lean in claustrophobically as this passage, likeall the others, disappears into the horizon.  `nHumidity `aclogs the air,and the sound of water dripping into small patches of odd, `bred-colored`a`amoss does nothing to alleviate the feeling of dread here.  Every so often,an odd streak of char is evident on the side of a wall, as if lanterns withtheir wicks not well trimmed once smoked and guttered in this maze.  Thereare very few landmarks in the godforsaken maze, for even the low chantingthat is everpresent here somehow blends with the echoing drip of water andtakes on a funereal air.``

`nEven in the air above Auvyron's Hell, the carnage is little differentthan that below.  Mad streaks of `fpurple `nand`n `kgold `nshow that Auvyron hastried to break his prison using his considerable magical skills.  Thick,`ametallic `nclouds scud from horizon to horizon, blown by ill, unnaturalwinds.  The stink of evil is heavy up this high, `nand`n twisted birds ofunknown origin, some sprouting three eyes, or extra beaks, dot the sky.Even from this great vantage, the magics that built this place warp anysense of direction, or perspective, making all paths seem one.

`cThis rather bland room acts as a haven for those about to challenge`bAuvyron's Hell`c```c.  Soft, verdant grass carpets the floor, and there is anatural light here, shining from a few cunningly placed refractive mirrors`c.A huge, `agray steel `cdoor is planted deep into the north wall`c.  Itsmechanism consists of a rusty winch that seems to be frozen solid`c.Unfortunately, that is not the case, for there is a Brother here who shakeshis head foolishly at your request for entry to the maze`c.

`nA `kholy `nfeeling of peace and contentment wash over your body as youenter this small shop.  A rough wooden counter divides the room neatly inhalf, and the low mutter of soldiers emanates from a passage to the east.The legend has it that Galnorin was one of the original creators if the`iHell of Auvyron`n, and retired to this spot soon afterwards to providesolace and assistance to those intrepid enough to brave this place ofmadness.  Galnorin taps his pipe out on the counter and gestures vaguely atthe back room, where low calls for wenches or ale can be heard.  ``
`iIF YOU'RE HERE, YOU SHOULDN'T BE.  IT'S ILLEGAL TO BE IN HERE, AND THEGODS WILL CURSE YOU AND YOUR PROGENY FOREVER.  THANKS A LOT....`K-->Mithra, Building Admin

`aAfter the wearing madness of the `bHell of Auvyron `a, this place seemsslightly confusing.  `a Calm, gray stone spirals up out of view overhead,and the sheer precision of this place suggests the keen intellect of amadman.  The walls and floor betray no fault of craftsmanship, and no wear,as if time slows to a crawl in this place while the world falls into ruinsin the outside world.  `lI`aron sconces placed high up overhead and filledwith scented candles cast bewildering shadows over all four walls.Stretching from floor to ceiling in the middle of this room is an ancientpillar of volcanic rock, scored with time and the strain of holding the`msoul`a of `bAuvyron`a.  Its evil glow reaches out for your own soul andgently tugs at it, pulling you physically forward.  ``

Rooms.TpMsg: `iCongratulations. You have solved the Hell of Auvyron. You gain 1750 experience points.``
Rooms.RoomDescription: `aThis egg-shaped chamber in the heart of the maze was where `bAuvyron`awas originally imprisoned.  Once being captured in secret so many yearsago, he was spirited underground to this place and his `msoul`a (or what wasleft of it at that time) was nailed into one of the stone pillars that formthe supports for the roof using nails specially prepared for this event.  Asthe years passed, `bAuvyron `awas able to expand his spirit and affect thereality of his immediate surroundings.  Unfortunately, it left his `msoul`abound to the gutrock of the Earth, where it could in time warp the realityof this place, imposed by holy prayer and the order set forth by the Creatorherself. A low dias has been set up in the far end of the chamber,for this is the place that the dread `bAuvyron `alurks, in waiting for thosebrave few who would dare challenge his greatness.
